description.narrative:
Statistics Sweden and National Institute of Statistics (NIS) in Cambodia has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 18 800 000 to carry out the "Cooperation Project between the National Institute of Statistics in Cambodia and Statistics Sweden" in Cambodia during the period 2020-2022.
The intervention aims at improving the quality of statistical production in Cambodia as well as the usage of this statistics by 1) improving the quality and usage of National Accounts; 2) improve the statistical capacity within NIS as well as the National Statistical System; 3) ensure a stable ICT infrastructure and ICT systems for managing, producing and disseminating data and Statistics; 4) increase NIS's capacity to disseminate key Statistics in a user-friendly way and increase statistical literacy among key users and; 5) strenthen internal coordination within NIS as well as the wider coordination mechanisms for coordination within the National Statistical System.
Statistics Sweden will implement the intervention together with the National Institute of Statistics (NIS) in Cambodia. The Department of Economic Policy within the Ministry of Economy and Finance is also a key stakeholder who will be a recipient of expertise from Statistics Sweden.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK 18 800 000.

Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB) och National Institute of Statistics (NIS) i Kambodja har ansökt om finansiering på SEK 18 800 000 från Sida för att genomföra "Cooperation Project between the National Institute of Statistics in Cambodia and Statistics Sweden" i Kambodja under perioden 2020-2022.
Insatsen syftar till att förbättra kvaliteten på statistisk produktion i Kambodja såväl som användningen av denna statistik genom att 1) ??förbättra kvaliteten och användningen av national räkenskaperna. 2) förbättra den statistiska kapaciteten inom NIS såväl som det nationella statistiska systemet; 3) säkerställa en stabil ICT-infrastruktur och ICT-system för att hantera, producera och sprida data och statistik; 4) öka NIS: s kapacitet att sprida nyckelstatistik på ett användarvänligt sätt och öka statistisk kunskaper bland nyckelanvändare och; 5) stärka den interna samordningen inom NIS såväl som de bredare samordningsmekanismerna för samordning inom det nationella statistiska systemet.
SCB kommer att genomföra projektet tillsammans med National Institute of Statistics (NIS) i Kambodja. Department of Economic Policy inom Ministry of Economy and Finance är också en viktig intressent som kommer kunna få mottaga expertrådgivning från SCB.
Insatsens totala budget är SEK 18 800 000.

The intervention forms one part of the Partnership for Accountability and Transparency (PAT) II programme. The PAT programme aims to complement EU's sector budget support to the PFM reform with the objective to facilitate "an enabling environment for the PFM reform by strengthened demand for and supply of public transparency and accountability through institutional capacity development". The overall objective for the intervention in the area of statistics is “that reliable and transparent statistical information is available for use in decision-making and for accountability”. NIS and Statistics Sweden will collaborate in four different areas. The expected outcomes per component are: Component 1: National Accounts - Improved quality and usage of National Accounts. - New socioeconomic data available for use in national accounts and other analysis (including SDGs). Component 2: Statistical methods - Statistical capacity improved within NIS and the national statistical system. Component 3: Communication and ICT - NIS has a stable ICT infrastructure and ICT systems for managing data, producing data and disseminating statistics. - NIS is able to disseminate key statistics in a user-friendly way. Increased statistical literacy among key users. Component 4: Management and Organisational Structure - Strengthened internal coordination within NIS. - Strengthened mechanisms for coordination within the national statistical system.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts.

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries.
